t: My Soul Waits for God Alone
To the choirmaster: according to Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.
For*pn God alone my soul waits in silence; from*ld him comes my salvation.
He*ln alone is my rock and my salvation, my*ld fortress; I shall not be greatly shaken.
How*pn long will all of you attack a man to*ld batter him, like*ld a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
They*ln only plan to thrust him down from his high position. They*ld take pleasure in falsehood. They*ln bless with their mouths, but*ld inwardly they curse. Selah*ig
For*pn God alone, O my soul, wait in silence, for*ld my hope is from him.
He*ln only is my rock and my salvation, my*ld fortress; I shall not be shaken.
On*ln God rests my salvation and my glory; my*ld mighty rock, my refuge is God.
Trust*pn in him at all times, O people; pour*ld out your heart before him; God*ld is a refuge for us. Selah*ig
Those*pn of low estate are but a breath; those*ld of high estate are a delusion; in*ln the balances they go up; they*ld are together lighter than a breath.
Put*ln no trust in extortion; set*ld no vain hopes on robbery; if*ld riches increase, set not your heart on them.
Once*pn God has spoken; twice*ld have I heard this: that*ln power belongs to God,
and*ld that to you, O Lord, belongs steadfast love. For*ln you will render to a man according*ld to his work.
